meanings.definition: To lightly tap or pat something.
meanings.sent1: She was dapping the table to get rid of the crumbs.
meanings.sent2: The drummer was dapping the drumsticks together before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat was dapping the toy mouse playfully around the room.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops were dapping softly on the window pane.
meanings.sent5: He was dapping his fingers on the desk nervously during the exam.

meanings.definition: A method of fishing using a small fly on the surface of the water.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa taught me how to do dapping when we went fishing last summer.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen had great success with dapping in the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed curious about the dapping happening near the shore.
meanings.sent4: The art of dapping requires patience and precision to lure the fish.
meanings.sent5: The sound of dapping on the water was soothing on the quiet afternoon.

meanings.definition: The action of dipping or bouncing something up and down.
meanings.sent1: The dapping of the basketball echoed in the gymnasium.
meanings.sent2: Children enjoy the dapping of their feet in puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The dapping of the paintbrush created a unique pattern on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The dapping of the heart monitor was a comforting sound in the hospital room.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic dapping of the drumsticks energized the crowd at the concert.
